column4: one thing i've never been able to grasp is correctly partioning a drive to dual boot windows 7 and ubuntu
the problem isn't the partitioning, it's not having windows overwrite grub, right?
I suppose because of how you will use them. You could always sequester each OS on like their own 10gb partition and then leave the rest as a FATxx filedump.
hard drives are cheap as all get out. It's kind of silly not to have more tb that you know what to do with as an end user.
